info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 6:00PM CDT until June 14 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CLARK...WEST CENTRAL GRANT...NORTH CENTRAL DALLAS... GARLAND...SOUTHWESTERN SALINE AND HOT SPRING COUNTIES... At 558 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hot Springs, moving southeast at 55 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR LOCATIONS WITHIN THE WARNING POLYGON AND THE CITY OF HOT SPRINGS. TAKE COVER NOW! LARGE FALLING HAIL CAN BE DEADLY! . HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Hot Springs Village... Malvern... Haskell... Mountain Pine... Rockport... Traskwood... Perla... Lonsdale... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Lake Ouachita State Park... Lofton... Rockwell... Hot Springs National Park... Donaldson... Friendship... Bismarck... Magnet Cove... Oaklawn Racetrack... Sunshine... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
